adrFormatAddress: 1120 6th Ave, New York, NY 10036, USA

editorialSummary.text: Melbourne-inspired coffee shop offering Australian-style espresso drinks and cafe fare all day.

originalText.text:
Wanted to like this Aussie origin cafe especially in the hope of finally getting a decent coffee in NYC.
The staff were abrupt and disengaged.
Avo toast was cold on arrival. Salmon and feta salad was mostly leafy greens and the salmon was not warm enough.
The cappuccino was just not right.
There was no cutlery. One of the three of our group received cutlery but not the other two. When we asked we were told they had run out.
We were given all food in takeaway boxes in spite of eating in. Try eating from a box without a knife and fork.
It‚Äôs close to a good cafe but they get all the little things wrong and just don‚Äôt seem to care.
The music was good.

originalText.text:
The takeaway portion is much smaller than other stores (originally only one piece of toast is provided for two pieces) üçû

The staff is not very active.

There are self-service ordering machines in the store so you can order by it.

Meals made on site so need to wait a bit.

There is a toilet
Desserts are available
There are many seats in the store

originalText.text: Every morning I get my Aussie iced latte w extra vanilla in it made perfectly by Maite and Vivi, they cheer my morning and get hyped me up early in the morning! I love seeing them every morning to get pumped up for work

text.text: Every morning I get my Aussie iced latte w extra vanilla in it made perfectly by Maite and Vivi, they cheer my morning and get hyped me up early in the morning! I love seeing them every morning to get pumped up for work

originalText.text:
I ordered ahead of time via Google and was told it would be ready in 8 minutes. I came maybe two minutes early but was ok with waiting. I noticed that the barista puts a cup aside and continues filling orders. People come and go and I'm still waiting FIVE minutes past my pickup time. It's only after that said time did she place my order on the counter. When I expressed my disappointment I was told that since it's a Google order they place it on the counter "just in case it's a pick up order." Thats an absolutely bogus reason to place something in the pickup counter almost twenty minutes after the order is placed. It may be only five minutes for you but I was further delayed with the rest of my day thanks to this barista.

The only reason why I'm giving two stars is because I previously had a pleasant interaction with the manager at this location. Otherwise I don't see a point in coming here anymore.

originalText.text: My long anticipated experience with Bluestone was not great. I visited the shop on a Saturday mid day a few days after the Christmas holiday in December. The shop was not overly busy, but only had one visible worker. She was overwhelmed by all the tasks she had to do which most likely contributed to the mediocre service and product. I ordered a hot coffee which ended up being Luke-warm and tasted bitter. No amounts of sugar or cream could have saved this coffee from itself.
